question: What is NTUC IncomeShield's coverage for non-standard rooms in a private hospital?
text: The provided text from the NTUC IncomeShield brochure details coverage for various ward classes in private hospitals, but doesn't specify coverage for non-standard rooms <cite><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 16-17</doc><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 17-19</doc><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 12-15</doc></cite>.  Deductibles for private hospital inpatient care vary based on ward class and the insured's age <cite><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 16-17 <quote>quote1</quote><quote>quote2</quote></doc></cite>.  For those 80 or younger, deductibles range from $1,500 (Ward C) to $3,500 (Ward A), increasing to $2,250 and $5,250 respectively for those over 80 <cite><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 16-17 <quote>quote1</quote><quote>quote2</quote></doc></cite>.  Pro-ration factors apply to private hospital treatment <cite><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 16-17 <quote>quote3</quote></doc></cite>.  While ward class distinctions suggest different coverage levels based on room type,  specific details on non-standard rooms are absent <cite><doc>Enhanced2024 pages 17-19</doc></cite>.
